title: Burthorpe–Troll Country War

properties.value: The Burthorpe–Troll Country War is a series of conflicts that occur between the Burthorpe Imperial Guard and the dangerous and aggressive mountain trolls of Death Plateau. It is of great importance for the Imperial Guard that Burthorpe, the last major settlement in Asgarnia with its own government, win the war in order to prove themselves. Otherwise the White Knights of Falador will take over the town, ending its semi-independence.[1] The war consists mainly of small battles or invasions in and around the Burthorpe area.[2]

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Burthorpe–Troll Country War
Burthorpe–Troll Country War
Beginning Late Fifth Age
End Ongoing
Place Burthorpe, Death Plateau
Combatants
Trolls of Death Plateau Burthorpe Imperial Guard
Commanders
Various troll generals Prince Anlaf, Commander Denulth
Casualties
Many trolls Many soldiers
Other wars
Concurrent war Keldagrim–Troll Country War
Next war None

The Burthorpe–Troll Country War is a series of conflicts that occur between the Burthorpe Imperial Guard and the dangerous and aggressive mountain trolls of Death Plateau. It is of great importance for the Imperial Guard that Burthorpe, the last major settlement in Asgarnia with its own government, win the war in order to prove themselves. Otherwise the White Knights of Falador will take over the town, ending its semi-independence.[1] The war consists mainly of small battles or invasions in and around the Burthorpe area.[2]

The ongoing efforts of the Imperial Guard are lead by Commander Denulth while Crown Prince Anlaf remains in hiding.[3]

Contents

  • 1 History
    • 1.1 Beginning
    • 1.2 Current situation
  • 2 References

History[edit | edit source]

Beginning[edit | edit source]

In the year 162 of the Fifth Age, Prince Anlaf's father, Prince Anlaf, fell ill to the point where he could no longer appear in public nor govern the kingdom. The White Knights took advantage of this and Sir Amik Varze became the de facto leader of Falador.[4] The hostile Kinshra, a Zamorakian military organisation in Asgarnia, was outlawed and a war erupted between the two, leading to the Battle of North Falador.

Money soon began to run low for the White Knights as campaigns against the Kinshra, such as the famous Dawn Ascent, required hefty funding. As such, the White Knights wished to stop funding the Burthrope Imperial Guard and take control of Burthrope themselves. However, the White Knights agreed to continue funding the Burthrope Imperial Guard if they were able to destroy the troll camp on Death Plateau.[1] As such, the war has become a primary focus for Burthorpe.

Current situation[edit | edit source]

The Imperial Guard have successfully managed to secure an underground cave that leads to a one of the cliffs of the Troll Country with the aid of an adventurer. From there, they can ambush any trolls heading for Burthorpe from Death Plateau, a major victory for Burthorpe.

An attack by the Imperial Guard, after the Trolls were cut off from Death Plateau, on the Troll Stronghold was defeated. The Guard suffered an unknown number of casualties, and Godric was captured. An adventurer used Dunstan's advice to use a secret route to approach the Troll Stronghold, but had to defeat Dad in the Troll Arena and kill a troll general to get a key to rescue Godric.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ 1.0 1.1 Denulth, "Burthorpe", Old School RuneScape. "The White Knights have overlooked us, until now! They are pouring money into their war against the Black Knights, so they are looking for an excuse to stop our funding and I'm afraid they may have found it! If we can not destroy the troll camp on Death Plateau then the Imperial Guard will be disbanded and Burthorpe will come under control of the White Knights."
  2. ^ Saba, "Death Plateau", Old School RuneScape. "It used to be just humans trampling past my cave and making a racket. Now there's those blasted trolls too! Not only do they stink and argue with each other loudly but they are always fighting the humans."
  3. ^ Eohric, Old School RuneScape. "We do not disclose his majesty's business."
  4. ^ Display case 26, Old School RuneScape. "The old king of Asgarnia, King Vallance, falls very ill. The White Knights took advantage of this and began to take control of Falador and Asgarnia for themselves."

The '''Burthorpe–Troll Country War''' is a series of conflicts that occur between the [[Burthorpe Imperial Guard]] and the dangerous and aggressive [[mountain troll]]s of [[Death Plateau (location)|Death Plateau]]. It is of great importance for the Imperial Guard that [[Burthorpe]], the last major settlement in [[Asgarnia]] with its own government, win the war in order to prove themselves. Otherwise the [[White Knights]] of [[Falador]] will take over the town, ending its semi-independence.{{NamedRef|Denulth}} The war consists mainly of small battles or invasions in and around the Burthorpe area.{{CiteNPC|npc=Saba|quote=It used to be just humans trampling past my cave and making a racket. Now there's those blasted trolls too! Not only do they stink and argue with each other loudly but they are always fighting the humans.|loc=Death Plateau}}

The ongoing efforts of the Imperial Guard are lead by [[Commander Denulth]] while Crown [[Prince Anlaf]] remains in hiding.{{CiteNPC|npc=Eohric|quote=We do not disclose his majesty's business.}}

==History==
===Beginning===
In the year 162 of the [[Fifth Age]], Prince Anlaf's father, [[Prince Anlaf]], fell ill to the point where he could no longer appear in public nor govern the kingdom. The White Knights took advantage of this and [[Sir Amik Varze]] became the de facto leader of [[Falador]].{{CiteText|text= Varrock Museum#2nd_floor3rd_floor_display_cases{{!}}Display case 26|quote=The old king of Asgarnia, King Vallance, falls very ill. The White Knights took advantage of this and began to take control of Falador and Asgarnia for themselves.}} The hostile [[Kinshra]], a [[Zamorak]]ian military organisation in Asgarnia, was outlawed and a war erupted between the two, leading to the [[Battle of North Falador]].

Money soon began to run low for the White Knights as campaigns against the Kinshra, such as the famous [[Dawn Ascent]], required hefty funding. As such, the White Knights wished to stop funding the Burthrope Imperial Guard and take control of Burthrope themselves. However, the White Knights agreed to continue funding the Burthrope Imperial Guard if they were able to destroy the troll camp on Death Plateau.{{CiteNPC|npc=Denulth|quote=The White Knights have overlooked us, until now! They are pouring money into their war against the Black Knights, so they are looking for an excuse to stop our funding and I'm afraid they may have found it! If we can not destroy the troll camp on Death Plateau then the Imperial Guard will be disbanded and Burthorpe will come under control of the White Knights.|loc=Burthorpe|name=Denulth}} As such, the war has become a primary focus for Burthorpe.

===Current situation===
The Imperial Guard have [[Death Plateau|successfully managed]] to secure an underground cave that leads to a one of the cliffs of the [[Troll Country]] with the aid of an adventurer. From there, they can ambush any trolls heading for Burthorpe from [[Death Plateau (location)| Death Plateau]], a major victory for Burthorpe.

[[Troll Stronghold|An attack]] by the Imperial Guard, after the Trolls were cut off from Death Plateau, on the Troll Stronghold was defeated. The Guard suffered an unknown number of casualties, and [[Godric]] was captured. An adventurer used [[Dunstan]]'s advice to use a secret route to approach the Troll Stronghold, but had to defeat [[Dad]] in the [[Troll Arena]] and kill a [[troll general]] to get a [[prison key|key]] to rescue Godric.
